meta.purpose: Complete official acronym definitions from confluence PDF export to prevent confusion

AAA_.definition: Prefix appended to an NPI hashed value indicating a segment for a visitor

AAAIP.definition: Prefix appended to an NPI hashed value indicating a segment for IP

AAAX_.definition: Prefix appended to an NPI hashed value indicating a segment for a person (match id)

AAAXH_.definition: Prefix appended to an NPI hashed value indicating a segment for a household id

AGI.definition: Key in click url to identify tactic

ALI.definition: 1p user matching, not an acronym sometimes referred to as a fingerprint id

AO.definition: Product name is Adaptive Optimization. Sometimes referred to as 'Adaptive Audience Optimization', or 'Adaptive Audiences'
AO.critical_note: DO NOT confuse with OA (Omnichannel Audiences) - they are completely different products

AOP.definition: Area of practices (Legal). An id based on a page

AWP.definition: Channel/token type system with various codes (SITE, SEARCH, MEDIA, EMAIL, etc.)

ConceptID.definition: Medscape contextual categorization of content on medscape.com

CPA.definition: Overall campaign spend divided by number of conversions

CPC.definition: A metric that measures how much an advertiser pays for each click on their ad

CPM.definition: A pricing model and metric used in digital advertising to measure the cost of 1,000 ad impressions. It's also known as cost per thousand

CPT.definition: Identifier of a treatment or procedure. Current Procedural Terminology (CPT) codes are a system of medical codes that identify and describe medical services and procedures

CTR.definition: A metric to measure how often people who see an ad end up clicking it (how effective an ad is at driving clicks)

DefLevels.definition: Identifies the event that occurred, for example an impression or click event, or a blocking event. Reasons for why the event occurred are identified in DefLevelReasons

DOOH.definition: Digital out of home impressions. Samsung menu ads

DSP.definition: Advertiser-side platform for campaign management and media buying

GAID.definition: IDFA stands for Identifier for Advertisers, which is a unique ID assigned by Apple to a user's device. Android has its own identifier version called Android Advertising ID (AAID), or Google Advertising ID (GAID). Both use hexadecimal formats, but IDFAs are uppercased while GAIDs are lower

HCM.definition: Health Campaign Managers (Managed account under Life)

HCP Explorer.definition: A workspace type within the studio platform that is designed to let users create highly targeted NPI (National Provider Identifier) lists and insights with minimal manual effort. Those NPI lists can be sent to Life, Omnichannel Audiences, HCP365 and WebMD's artemis platform

HCPCS.definition: The Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) is a collection of codes that represent medical services, supplies, products, and procedures. HCPCS codes are used by insurance companies and Medicare to process health insurance claims

HIPAA.full_name: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
HIPAA.definition: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) is a federal law that required the creation of national standards to protect sensitive patient health information from being disclosed without the patient's consent or knowledge

HUID.definition: Heuristic User Identification - Formulated by webmd and medscape as a global identifier for an HCP or person

IAB Category.definition: Developed by the Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) – the industry body for digital advertising – IAB categories are standard classifications that publishers and brands use to categorise web content and, therefore, improve targeting

ICD-10.definition: International Classification of Diseases. These are diagnosis (ICD-10-CM) and procedure (ICD-10-PCS) medical billing codes

IDFA.definition: IDFA stands for Identifier for Advertisers, which is a unique ID assigned by Apple to a user's device

KOL.definition: Key Opinion Leaders (Pharma term of the decision makers)

MeSH.definition: Medical Subject Headings - Every medical condition. Sometimes referred to as Health Categories

Moments.definition: Sometimes referred to as Contextual, Medscape Moments, Affinity, Topics, Concepts. Essentially the Moments dataset encompasses all user activity for an NPI that occurs on a site. This is categorized into MeSH, IAB Category, Topic and Concept. Its used to measure the type and level of content consumed by an NPI

MPC.definition: Backend running life - Old buyer portal

NBRx.definition: New to Brand prescriptions - NPIs who have never written a prescription for the brand, or have not been written the Rx in more than 12 months

NDC.definition: Identifier of a drug. A National Drug Code is a unique 10-digit number that identifies drugs in the United States. The FDA maintains the NDC and uses it to track all drugs that are manufactured, prepared, or processed for commercial distribution

NPL.definition: Natural Language Processing. All our contextualizers: IAB contextualizer, MeSH contextualizer, Endemic contextualizer and so on

OA.definition: Product name is Omnichannel Audiences. Some may call this Social or Search. This platform enables users to create an audience using a NPI list and send that audience to activation platforms outside of pulsepoint. These include but are not limited to, Meta(Facebook,Instagram…), LinkedIn, X(Twitter), Reddit, Pinterest, Google Search, Youtube, Microsoft Ads (Bing)
OA.critical_note: DO NOT confuse with AO (Adaptive Optimization) - they are completely different products

P&T.definition: The P&T committee is generally the medical staff committee responsible for managing the formulary system. The P&T committee provides an evaluative, educational, and advisory service to the medical staff and organizational administration in all matters pertaining to the use of available medications

PG.definition: A Programmatic Guaranteed (PG) deal is a fixed number of ad impressions that a buyer commits to purchasing at a set price. PG deals are an automated way to buy ads that allows buyers to negotiate directly with publishers

PHI.definition: Is any individually identifiable information, including demographic information, created or received by the Covered Entity (CE)

PII.definition: Personally Identifiable Information, ie. Email Address, First/Last Name, Phone Number, Physical Address

PLD.definition: Physician Level Data - Log level event data for an NPI

PMP.definition: A Private Marketplace (PMP) deal is a type of real-time bidding (RTB) auction where a publisher sells premium inventory to a select group of advertisers

PSM.definition: Platform Solutions Management / Platform success manager

Reach.definition: Generally speaking, the total number of unique people who got exposed to ad campaign. In 365 reach is calculated at the profession and/or specialty level. Where the digital identified universe is the denominator to the exposed NPIs

RTB.definition: Auction-based system for buying and selling digital advertising inventory in real-time

SSP.definition: Publisher-side platform for managing and optimizing ad inventory

Studio.definition: Sometimes referred to as Genome Studio, but the product name is Studio. Studio is PulsePoint's advanced AI-driven audience and data platform. Studio uses Workspace Types which are applications within the platform that fulfill specific use cases. HCP Explorer is an example of one Workspace type
Studio.critical_note: Studio is broader than just Omnichannel - it's a comprehensive audience and data platform

TopicID.definition: WebMD contextual categorization of content on webmd.com

VGUID.definition: PulsePoint's cookie identifier, if in a mobile application then this will show the IDFA or GAID
